page.title: 04THE MALVERN HILLS
page.content:
The Malverns are among the oldest hills in the world-some 600 million years old.{Bronze and Iron Age remains {have been found.There were prehistoric {camps on Midsummer Hill and British {Camp.}The hard rock was quarried at first for road making,later for building in granite and for the many stone walls that are a feature of Malvern.
The Malvern Hills are an area of out standing natural beauty.{The Worcester {shire Beacon is the highest point {of the hills 1,395feet or 425 metres. {The Worcestershire Beacon,with a {pleasant chalet-style cafe nearby, {boasts a toposcope with an engraved {map displaying the surrounding {countryside.}The Malvern Hills are very high and lofty rising like stairs one above the other.
